const app = express(); this code Creates an instance of an Express application
// allows the server to handle requests from different origins:  app.use(cors());
// parses incoming JSON requests:  app.use(express.json());
Correct, this is the root or home route of the application. The function will be processed if a user accesses the application home "/" and will send the identified response.

question: Which part of the code defines how the application should respond to requests to the root path ('/')? Identify the specific line(s) of code that handle these requests.
